newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - June 11.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - June 11.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Wednesday:
* The Dow Jones industrial average roared past yet another milestone on Tuesday, rising 60.77 to close at a historic high of 7,539.27, reflecting a market that remained awash in cash.
* Indonesia said on Tuesday that Japanese officials had asked for a cut in import tariffs on automobiles brought into the country and that the proposal was being studied.
* On Tuesday, the Jakarta composite index was down 2.74 points at 689.77 points on continued local-led profit-taking focused on medium and small stocks, brokers said.
* On Wednesday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,427.50/28.00 at 0210 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,428.00/29.00.

* Blue chip Bank Negara Indonesia on market talk of a possible merger with another state bank Bank Tabungan Negara. The speculation was revived by reports in a local newspaper which said the government will merge the seven state banks into four banks.
* Bank Duta after it said that it will pay 130 rupiah dividend for 1996 compared with 125 rupiah in 1995.
* Glass maker Asahimas following the firm's announcement that it expected its export sales to grow to 34.0 percent of total net sales for 1997, compared to 28.5 percent in 1996.
* Bank Panin after its shareholders approved a plan for a 14-for-7 rights issue with three attached warrants at a price of 1,200 rupiah each.
* Consumer finance firm PT Bunas Finance after the company indicated that its first quarter net profit was 135 percent higher compared with the same 1996 period.
* Bank Mashill following reports that Bank Brussels Lambert of Belgium has bought a 10 percent stake from its outstanding shares in the market.
* Confectionery firm Mayora Indah on reports that its planned 300 billion rupiah bond had received an "A "rating from Indonesia's rating agency Pefindo.
* Small paper manufacturer Suparma on reports that it has received shareholder approval to acquire privately-owned PT Siantar Maju at an estimated value of 9.9 billion rupiah.
* PT Apac Centertex Corporation , formerly known as Mayatexdian, on a plan to build a pulp plant in Kalimantan with annual production capacity of over 300,000 tonnes.
* Shipping and sea transportation company PT Berlian Laju Tanker on reports that it had secured a $68 million syndicated loan. It will be used to purchase 10 chemical tankers.
